member.name: T:SuperSocket.Common.BufferManager
member.summary:
This class creates a single large buffer which can be divided up and assigned to SocketAsyncEventArgs objects for use with each socket I/O operation. This enables bufffers to be easily reused and gaurds against fragmenting heap memory.
The operations exposed on the BufferManager class are not thread safe.

member.name: M:SuperSocket.Common.BufferManager.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:SuperSocket.Common.BufferManager.InitBuffer
member.summary: Allocates buffer space used by the buffer pool

member.name: M:SuperSocket.Common.BufferManager.SetBuffer(System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs)
member.summary: Assigns a buffer from the buffer pool to the specified SocketAsyncEventArgs object
member.returns: true if the buffer was successfully set, else false

member.name: M:SuperSocket.Common.BufferManager.FreeBuffer(System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs)
member.summary: Removes the buffer from a SocketAsyncEventArg object. This frees the buffer back to the buffer pool
